Posts.Content: I too have found a lump i am having it removed on June 22, they think it is a fibroadenoma (benign) they are more common in younger women (i'm 30). It is also easier to feel mine when i am laying down, but i also had to find it first with my fingers and then have the doc feel it. I agree with Twiggy do what ever you have too to have the doc feel it and also ask for an ultrasound. It is better to be safe than sorry! Please keep us posted. Starr92
Posts.Title: Found a lump.

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, Went to the surgeon today, he's pretty sure it is a fibroadenoma. He gave me the option to either leave it or have it removed. I think for MY piece of mind i might have it removed to be 100% sure. He said it would be done at the hospital (outpatient) with a local. Twiggy thanks for your input since you just went through this, how did the removel go? How long did it take? was it done in a hospital? How big is the scar? Sorry for all the questions but i have never had any kind of anything done to me! LOL A little nervous! My lump is about the size of a pea. Thanks Again for all you help!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Hello All, I have been having alot of pain (tender, Sore) in my left breast for about 3 weeks. I was doing a breast exam and felt a small lump about the size of a pea.I went to my gyno yesterday he also felt it and sent me to get a mammogram/ultrasound. Which i got done today, the mammogram showed nothing,(they said probalby because of my age i'm 30)so they did the ultrasound. the lump i have the tech said is very mobile and she had a hard time seeing it on ultrasound she actually had to hold her finger on the lump and then place the wand right over it to try and catch it. When the doc came in he really did'nt say much, but i did ask if it was a cyst and he said no. He suggested i get another ultrasound in 3 months, but i have an appt with a breast surgeon on Thursday so i will see what he thinks. Sorry this is so long but i can't sleep or eat i am so scared when i think of breast cancer. Has anyone had an experience with a lump you can feel but not see?? I also have pain in my breast as well as under my arm, any ideas what this could be?? Any help would be great
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Well that doesn't sound to bad... i don't know if i could watch though! I would be curious as to what the "lump" actually looks like though. My is kinda on the outer part of my breast closer to my armpit, so maybe the scar will not be that noticable. At first i was thinking i would just leave it but the more i think about it, it's driving me NUTS! Better to get it out and be safe. I am going to call the surgeon's office in the morning and see when i can get this done. I will let you know when i get a date hope it is soon. Thank You so much for taking the time to answer my questions, it really does help!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: I do not think i want to be sedated either, although i am very nervous it's really the waiting that get me! I think once i am there and know it is going to be done i will be fine. Two more questions for ya..LOL How long after the procedure was done were you able to leave the hospital? Right after or do you go to some kind of recovery? And last how quick do you get the results back? Thanks so much for listening and helping!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Twiggy! You must have read my mind as i just thinking about posting to you for more questions! I have a date set for June 16th for pre-admission testing? blood work etc. The surgery date is set for june 22 at noon. They told me to report at 10:30A.M. for admission etc. Is this how it worked for you? I really am looking forward to getting this over with, but i am very nervous about getting it done!! if that makes any sense? They also told me i would be given a local with sedation? Is this what you had or only the local? I am not sure if i want to be sedated, i just want to kinda of get in and get out of there ya know! LOL Also i am worried because alot of what i have read says that fibroadenoma is not painful? My breast is tender right around where the lump is and a dull ache in my armpit, (the lump is on the outer part of my left breast close to my armpit) Did you also have pain like this with yours? Sorry for all the questions but this waiting is so hard... I THANK YOU so much for taking the time to answer my questions! i really am grateful!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for all the info...just talking with someone who has been through this helps so much and knowing more what to expect at the hospital also puts my mind at ease....alittle! lol My husband will be going with me also, I am counting the days till this is over and praying for good news. I know what you mean about being parnoid this experinece has already made me much more aware of my body and has changed my way of thinking! I promise to keep you posted as the days go on! Thanks Again!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: I am so sorry to hear about your friend... please try and stay postive, i know it is hard believe me! My husband is always telling me not to worry until you have somehting to worry about! He is the most postive person i have ever met! Which is good sometimes...but sometimes i just want to stab him in the eye! lol Your friend will be in my thoughts and prayers please let me know how everything goes for her... also if you need to talk or to vent i am here.. you have really helped me get through this esp. letting me know what to expect as far as the procedure etc,.. it is the least i can do! I also will keep you posted after my dr. appt on thurs. Starr
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, Thank you all for keeping an eye on me! I got to the hospital around 10:30 A.M. registered etc.. then i had to sit around and wait till almost 1 P.M.! (Surgeon was running late) surprize,surprize! But once he took me, the surgery took about 1/2 hour and wasn't that bad. I am very sore today though, because it was on the outside of my breast i can't even move or lift my arm without it "pulling" on the incision. He said it looked benign and not to worry, i go see him for a follow up on thurs. 6/30 and he will have the path report then. I am so happy that part is over! Now i just have to heal and wait again for the report! Being on this board has really halped me get through this so thanks again! Twiggy how are you feeling? Starr
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi, Thanks for checking in on me! I am healing ok..still a bit sore though. I also get these pains (only last for a few seconds) that go down towards my ribs? Don't know what that is? I will ask the dr. though.. My appt is for 4pm tomorrow. A little nervous but happy to finally get my "offical" report! I am Sooooo happy for the great news on your friend! I will keep her in my thoughts and prayers. I will post as soon as i get home from the dr.! Starr
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Thank you both for the input. I did fill out a form so i can pick up all the results on Monday or Tuesday to bring to the surgeon on Thursday. You are right about the waiting it is driving me NUTS!! I can't stop thinking about it. But i am so lucky i have wonderful family around me who are very supportive and a great husband, i thank god for that. The fact that the lump is mobile, and is painful is a good sign but you never know. I also have a pain in my left shoulder blade which the gyno said could be from this, but the doc today said no?? So that is confusing also? It is so scary when this happens. I thank you again and i will keep you posted as i find out more!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: Actually My procedure is going to be done tomorrow, have to be at the hospital by 10:30 and surgery is set for noon. They sure do make you wait! I am pretty nervous right now, but am looking forward to getting it over with. I will let you know how it goes tomorrow when i get back. Thanks for asking!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Felt but Not Seen? 1 2

Posts.Content: hello all, BENIGN!!! Yoo Hoo! went to my doc today removed my bandages etc he said i am healing fine! Also he gave me a copy of my report: Benign Fibroadenoma (fibrocystic changes). What a HUGE relief! He also said the pain is probably the nerves healing, it is an odd pain. Mandalin- i know how scary this is but please go to your doc ASAP! The best thing to do is to get it checked out. This board is really great so if you have any questions please ask, and also let me know when you go! Twiggy thank you again for all the info and help you have been great! Enjoy the holiday weekend! Starr
